subject: Politics
title: Modern Monarchies
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Modern Monarchies.

hook.text: Saudi Arabia's king rules with absolute power. Britain's king cuts ribbons. Monarchy has many faces.

buildup.text: Absolute monarchies give rulers total authority. Constitutional monarchies make them figureheads.

discovery.text: About 43 nations still have monarchs. Most are ceremonial, but a few hold real executive power.

twist.text: Constitutional monarchies like Sweden and Japan rank among the world's most stable democracies.

climax.text: Abolishing monarchy is risky. Thailand jails people who criticize the king under strict laws.

punchline.text: Some kings rule. Others reign. The difference defines a nation.

quiz.question: How many nations still have monarchs?
